38_18.sketch: The rows here are silent. No fruit remains, only moss and rusted tools.

39_18.sketch: A damp haze clings to the grasses. Your boots leave no sound behind.

40_18.sketch: The ground is torn from dozens of hooves. A scattering of fur and crushed fern remain.

41_18.sketch: A single black feather rests beside a patch of drying blood. The air is still.

42_18.sketch: A bootprint at the edge of the ridge. Someone passed here, fast and quiet.

46_18.sketch: Far across the valley, something howls once — then silence.

47_18.sketch: Three stones, carefully placed. No markings. Just silence beneath the pines.

48_18.sketch: The earth is blackened here. Ash clings to broken branches.

49_18.sketch: A figure once stood here. The grass bows outward in a perfect circle.

50_18.sketch: The ground here is fractured — something was dug and reburied long ago.
